content:
Diagnosis:
Metastatic mucinous adenocarcinoma of ascending colon with liver and lung metastases

Initial Staging:
T4aN2bM0 (Stage IIIB) at diagnosis January 2023
Progressed to metastatic disease March 2024

Biomarker Status:
ERBB2 (HER2) amplification detected?
Microsatellite stable
BRAF wild type
KRAS wild type

Previous Treatment:
Right hemicolectomy January 2023
Adjuvant CAPOX completed July 2023
Palliative FOLFIRI/Bevacizumab March-May 2024

Current Situation:
Disease progression on current treatment

I reviewed [redacted name] today who attended with his wife. Unfortunately, his most recent CT scan from 15th May 2024 shows clear evidence of disease progression with growth of both liver metastases (largest lesion increased from 3.2cm to 4.8cm) and new pulmonary nodules. His performance status has declined to ECOG 2, with increasing fatigue and right upper quadrant discomfort requiring regular breakthrough analgesia.

He has also developed grade 3 neutropenia with his current FOLFIRI/Bevacizumab regimen, requiring two dose reductions and multiple treatment delays. His latest blood tests show deteriorating liver function with bilirubin 45 and ALT 156.

Given the confirmation of ERBB2 amplification in his tumor, and clear evidence of disease progression, I have discussed switching his treatment to FOLFIRI with Trastuzumab and Pertuzumab. I have explained the rationale for this change and potential side effects, including cardiac monitoring requirements. [redacted name] understands this represents his best treatment option at present.

Plan:
1. Discontinue current FOLFIRI/Bevacizumab
2. Arrange baseline cardiac ECHO and ECG
3. Start FOLFIRI/Trastuzumab/Pertuzumab once cardiac assessment complete
4. Weekly review of liver function
5. Urgent referral to palliative care team for symptom management
6. CT reassessment after 3 cycles

We will review him again in one week with cardiac results and to commence new treatment regimen if appropriate.
